bad.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: unpleasant or likely to cause problems
bad.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: I have some bad news for you.
I thought things couldn’t possibly get any worse.
The plane was delayed for several hours by bad weather.
It’s difficult to break bad habits.
bad.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: low in quality or below an acceptable standard
bad.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: The failure of the company was due to bad management.
Your handwriting is so bad I can hardly read it.
That was the worst movie I’ve ever seen.
bad.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: not sensible, or not suitable in a particular situation
bad.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Cutting spending at this time is a bad idea.
Making big changes in your diet all at once is a bad thing to do.
bad.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: He’s a bad man – keep away from him.
bad.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: doing something you should not do, or behaving in a wrong way – used especially about children or pets
bad.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Bad cat! Get off the table!
bad.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: He was in a bad accident.
The pain in my side is worse than it was yesterday.
bad.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: Pollution is having a bad effect on fish stocks.
It is bad for kids to be on their own so much.
Smoking is bad for your health.
Too much salt can be bad for you.
bad.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: food that is bad is not safe to eat because it has decayed
bad.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: having no skill or ability in a particular activity
bad.translation[0].definitions[8].exampl: They have got to be the worst band on the planet.
bad.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: bad language is rude or offensive
bad.translation[0].definitions[9].exampl: We were shocked to hear the little boy using bad language in front of his mother.
bad.translation[0].definitions[10].defin: used when you think something is very good
bad.translation[0].definitions[11].defin: someone who is bad is very determined and does not always obey rules – used to show approval
bad.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: not as good as it could be or should be
A poor diet can lead to ill health.
not good – often used instead of saying directly that something was ‘bad’, especially when you were disappointed by it
not as good as you hoped or expected
a disappointing start to the campaign
bad – used when talking about the bad result or effect of something
All the publicity had a negative impact on sales.
the negative effects of climate change
The policy had some undesirable consequences.
drug abuse and other undesirable behaviour
unfavourable conditions are not good for doing something
The boat race was cancelled because of unfavourable weather.
Her house is in a terrible state.
very bad, especially in a way that shocks or upsets you
He describes prison as ‘a horrible place’.
The weather has been lousy all week.
I’m fed up with this lousy job.
severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad and serious
The country faces severe economic problems.
He suffered severe head injuries in a car crash.
extremely bad in a way that is shocking
Her behaviour has been absolutely atrocious.
The country has an appalling human rights record.
very bad and of a very low standard
the abysmal conditions in some prisons
bad.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a word used to mean ‘badly’ that many people think is incorrect
bad.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: a bad debt, loan, investment etc is one from which you will not be able to get your money back
bad.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: Barclays have sharply increased their provision for bad corporate debts.
The bank has more than a half billion dollars of bad assets.
bad.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: if you are a particular amount of money to the bad, you have lost or owe that amount
bad.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: Thanks to your mistake, I’m £500 to the bad!
